title: Agden Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Stan Atkinson / Agden Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Agden Reservoir. Taken from crags above Rocher Woods

images.title: Alan Murray-Rust / Hillside above Agden Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Hillside above Agden Reservoir From the footpath round Rocher Top. Water level is quite low despite the summer's rainfall.

images.title: Neil Theasby / Smallfield north of Agden Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Small field north of Agden Reservoir. Looking west towards Strines. Heather burning on horizon.

images.title: Chris Wimbush / Emlin hillside towards Agden Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Heather on Emlin hillside towards the reservoir

images.title: Cricket at Low Bradfield by Stephen McKay, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cricket at Low Bradfield. A pleasant village scene located just south of the lake.

images.title: Agden Dike flowing towards the reservoir by Andrew Hill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Agden Dike flowing towards the reservoir. This scene can be found just to the north.

images.title: Footbridge at the very end of Agden reservoir. by steven ruffles, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Footbridge at the very end of Agden reservoir.

images.title: Old Horns Inn, High Bradfield, near Sheffield - 2012 style by Terry Robinson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Old Horns Inn, High Bradfield. A good option for rest and refreshment after your exercise.

description: Enjoy a circular walk around this pretty reservoir on the edge of the Peak District near Sheffield. The walk starts at the village of Low Bradfield and follows a popular footpath around the water with some nice woodland trails to enjoy too. There's great views across the water to the surrounding countryside. The footpath runs for just over 2 miles on fairly flat paths so it's suitable for most abilities. Agden is part of a series of reservoirs in the area. To extend your walk you could head to Damflask Reservoir where there is another nice circular footpath to try. Also nearby are Dale Dike Reservoir and Strines Reservoir .
